Intro

aphla is a python library for accelerator commissioning and beam study. It is initially developed at the National Synchrotron Light Source II, Brookhaven National Laboratory. It takes advantages of NSLS-II service oriented architecture, e.g. channel finder service, model service and unit conversion service, to become a package more than equipment control. aphla could be used for other facilities.

Get Started

A simple example which read the current orbit and show the plot

>>> import aphla as ap
>>> ap.machines.load("nsls2")
>>> ap.machines.use("SR")
>>> ap.getOrbit(spos=True)
>>> for bpm in ap.getElements('BPM'): print bpm.sb, bpm.name, bpm.x, bpm.y
  • Tutorial has more details for the installation and settings
  • Code examples are always helpful for impatient people like me.
  • Get help with the Python built-in functions: help([object]) and dir([object])
